transcript.text: shabbat shalom this is daniel john lee
with tour restoration ministries it is
the 18th Shabbat of the year 18 Shabbat
since the shemitah year began back in
early April I don't know if this picture
is a sunrise or sunset but I suppose it
doesn't matter since Shabbat began last
night Friday night as the sunset and now
here it is shabbat morning on this 18th
Shabbat this has been a real real tough
week for me I was really struggling at
work and things and but one thing that
yeah really taught me is that even when
there's a lot of struggles even when
things are very very hard you don't let
that get you down you just continue to
rejoice in him and rejoice in all the
blessings that he's given you and and
just allow him to just comfort you and
last night after the Shabbat had begun
I'd had some fellowship with some
friends my friends in Canada and he led
me to psalm thirty and I just want to
read it right now I will extolled the oh
yah way for thou has lifted me up and
you have not made my foes to rejoice
over me Oh Yahweh my Elohim I cried unto
thee and you have healed me Oh Yahweh
thou has brought up my soul from the
grave that was kept me alive that I
should not go down to the pit sing unto
yahweh oh you saints of his and give
thanks at the remembrance of his
holiness for his anger and doors but a
moment and in his favor is life weeping
may endure for a night but joy comes in
the morning and in my prosperity I said
I shall never be moved Yahweh by your
favor you have made my mountain to stand
strong you did hide your face and I was
troubled I cried to you Oh Yahweh and
under Yahweh I made supplication what
profit is there in my blood when I go
down to the pit shall the dust praise
you shall declare your truth hero Yahweh
and have mercy upon me Yahweh be thou my
help
that was turn for me my mourning into
dancing hallelujah that was put off my
sackcloth and girded me with gladness to
the end of my glory may sing praise to
thee not be silent Oh Yahweh my elohim i
will give thanks unto thee forever
hallelujah look thing i love about the
Psalms as they go through the wide range
of emotions you know David and the
others who wrote these Psalms they were
never never never afraid to express
their full emotions to Yahshua and yet
they were always very very thankful to
him so I I love that I love that the
last week last shabbat there was just
this huge breakthrough at the
congregation that i attend khm we all
had to meet in sort of a smaller room
because the sanctuary that we normally
used was was being used for other
purposes and Phillip who goes there was
able to use his guitar to lead the
praise and worship and man the spirit
just came in so powerfully and it was
just it was just awesome it was just a
major major breakthrough at khm and then
when the pastor was giving his lesson we
were able to interact with him and it
was more like a kind of like style
almost like a Jewish synagogue where
there was actually interaction between
us and the pasture and it was just a
really really edifying time so that was
a that was a huge blessing and then
Jerry and I we went to a park toward
sunset toward evening and just had a
really good time of preaching and
interacting with people there and just
reaching people that are still still
embracing the message still wanting to
at least being edified by some of the
things that we're saying of course
obviously we're always going to have
people that don't like what we're saying
because people general in this culture
don't like the truth but we out it was
it's always a blessing to have someone
like I had this one guy named Isaac came
up and actually shook by hand and was
very edified by by the things that we
were we were preaching so that was that
was a huge encouragement so was it it
was
huge breakthrough shabbat last shabbat
and of course against the kickback this
week is it's been a it's been a huge
struggle of a week but now that it's
Shabbat again I'm just so rejoicing I'm
so rejoicing and it's such a blessing
Shabbat is such a blessing especially
after you have a week where there's a
lot of struggles it's like ah thank you
yeah that's what I love about his
Commandments is that as long as our
hearts right with him we love Him his
Commandments are always such a blessing
to us always such a blessing and I'm
very thankful for that hallelujah well
this is just a very short podcast I want
to wish you all a very wonderful shabbat
shalom and remember when you go through
struggles or you have things that are
difficult in your life I just always
remember that yacht is good he is good
and look at all the blessings that he's
given you and just keep focused on him
hallelujah and I preached that to myself
just as much as I say that to you guys
hallelujah shabbat shalom the website is
